outcome_description: GO — at least one unexplored high-leverage intervention (label geometry training at breakeven-favorable ratios) has 55-60% prior probability of producing positive per-trade expectancy. Phase 1 label geometry training is the single highest-priority next experiment.

highest_priority_next_experiment.name: Phase 1 label geometry training
highest_priority_next_experiment.hypothesis: XGBoost at 15:3 geometry achieves directional accuracy > breakeven WR (33.3%) + 2pp, and CPCV expectancy > $0.00 at base costs ($3.74 RT)
highest_priority_next_experiment.success_criterion: Positive CPCV expectancy at at least one of 4 candidate geometries (10:5, 15:3, 19:7, 20:3)

open_questions_ranked.question: Phase 1 label geometry training — does accuracy transfer to high-ratio geometries?
Cost reduction investigation (limit orders, maker rebates)

accuracy_gap_current.description: Model accuracy (0.4504) minus breakeven WR. Negative at 10:5 (model below breakeven), positive at 15:3 and 20:3 (model above breakeven, IF accuracy transfers)

expectancy_gap_current.description: Best model expectancy vs $0.00 breakeven. CPCV: $0.001 below. Walk-forward: $0.140 below.

cpcv_vs_walkforward_gap.description: CPCV accuracy 0.4504 vs WF 0.4524 (+0.2pp, good agreement). CPCV expectancy -$0.001 vs WF -$0.140 ($0.139 gap, large disagreement). WF is deployment-realistic.

label_geometry_viability_prior.reasoning: 10-15pp accuracy tolerance at high-ratio geometries (15:3, 20:3). Feature-binding argument (XGB plateau: 0.33pp range) supports accuracy stability across label changes. Model profitable down to 35% at 15:3 and 30% at 20:3. Central risk: model may shift to hold-majority predictions at wider targets.

T1_go_nogo.key_evidence: Label geometry lever: 20pp breakeven WR reduction (53.3% to 33.3%). 10-15pp accuracy tolerance. Low cost (2-4h). Oracle edge $4.00/trade (R7). Walk-forward divergence tempers optimism but geometry effect dwarfs it.

T2_oracle_wrong_variable.key_evidence: Oracle net exp inversely correlated with model viability in high-ratio region. 16:10 (oracle #1, $4.13) → model -$1.56. 15:3 (oracle ~80th, $1.74) → model +$2.63. Oracle margin geometry-invariant (10-12pp).

T3_accuracy_transfer.key_evidence: For transfer: XGB plateau (features binding), oracle margin stable, trade counts adequate. Against: label shift (more holds), long recall 0.149 may worsen, zero empirical data. Central uncertainty of program.

T4_cnn_closed.key_evidence: 5 experiments: e2e-cnn (-5.9pp), 9E (exp -$0.37), 9B (pipeline), 9D (R2=0.084 proper), R3b-genuine (p=0.21). Spatial signal encodes variance not boundaries.

closed_lines.evidence: 0/40 dual threshold passes; LSTM/Transformer worse than book MLP

closed_lines.line: Oracle net exp as viability metric
closed_lines.evidence: Inverse correlation with model viability in high-ratio region

sanity_checks.SC_S1_detail: 23 experiments in evidence matrix, covering all entries in RESEARCH_LOG.md plus infrastructure phases
sanity_checks.SC_S2_detail: All 4 tensions resolve to single consistent verdicts. No logical contradictions.
sanity_checks.SC_S3_detail: All 8 closed lines cite >= 2 supporting experiments (except Line 6 and Line 7 which each have 1 very strong experiment; but Line 6 is additionally supported by xgb-tuning + e2e-cnn consistency, and Line 7 by R7 + prior SYNTHESIS.md analysis)
sanity_checks.SC_S4_detail: All 5 ranked questions have specific hypotheses with direction, magnitude, and success criteria

notes: Pure analysis experiment — no model training, no computation beyond file I/O. All 23 experiments loaded and cross-referenced. MVE gates passed: 3 recent results consistent, 2/4 prior recommendations acted on. Evidence matrix complete (23 x 5). 4 tensions resolved. 8 closed lines compiled. 5 open questions ranked with priors. Key strategic insight: breakeven WR (not oracle net exp) is the correct viability metric. The project was optimizing the wrong variable for 6+ experiments. Phase 1 label geometry training resolves the central uncertainty.
